element.name: Glorious Garlic by Orangetigerprawn, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)
element.long-description:
This is a linear park on the banks of the Ward River South of Swords town. It covers an area of 89 ha. (220 acres) between Swords Town Centre and Knocksedan Bridge. Features of interest include some 12th century fortifications, woodland habitats, wetlands and rolling grassland. There are viewing points, picnic sites, a public playground, sports pitches and tennis courts.
Opening Hours:
The park is open all year round during the following hours:
November to January: 10.00am - 5.00pm
February to March 10.00am - 6.00pm
April 10.00am - 7.00pm
May 10.00am - 8.00pm
June to August 10.00am - 9.00pm
September 10.00am - 8.00pm
October 10.00am - 7.00pm The Cache
The cache is located in the wild west end of the park. The level of difficulty may depend on, and change according to, your chosen starting point and your tolerance of the wonderful aroma of wild garlic in the spring. Many of the paths at this end of the park can be steep, overgrown, muddy and slippy.
The cache can be approached by the direct method or by using the two waypoints which will bring you to the cache by an easier route. The coordinates were averaged 150 times to an accuracy of 2.7 metres; hopefully helping with satellite reception under the trees.
The cache is a waterproof container of about a litre in capacity.
element.additional-waypoints:
FP1Q6XR - Forest Path
N 53° 27.397 W 006° 14.598
The path into the forest is the nicest way to go but you can take a route further south through the football pitches.
JP1Q6XR - Jungle Path
N 53° 27.400 W 006° 15.010
Nearly there. It gets harder from here. Easiest to stay below the skeletal trees.
element.encoded-hints: Stan ******** who had a 1986 No 5 hit with "Camouflage" has fallen on hard times. Famous old Dublin Market on Francis Street.

ul.li:
2009-12-13T20:00:00Z : Found it by Caturah_Winterhart
In hindsight, I almost wish I'd left this cache till a drier day. How and ever, wet and muddied from the knees down, I finally zoomed in on the cache location and retrieved the cache quite easily. TFTC.

2009-11-08T14:42:10Z : Update Coordinates by orangetigerprawn
** Coordinates Changed From ** N 53° 27.413 W 006° 15.190 Distance From Old: 515.4 feet Having read some of the finds and DNFs particularly those relating to fences and being overlooked I moved the cache to a accessible location. Visiting the site was more difficult than when placed and the easiest way to the cache was blocked by fencing and barbed wire that had not been there previously. I got to the cache without crossing any fences but there was a large Trespassers Prosecuted sign very close by.
The new location is about 150 metres east of the original location.
New coordinates: N 53° 27.438 W 006° 15.054
Old coordinates: N 53° 27.413 W 006° 15.190
I'm also adding two waypoints to help access.

2009-09-17T12:35:52Z : Found it by one747
Greetings from Australia! I came the hardcway! Took tb left nothing. Last cache in Ireland. TFTC

2009-08-06T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by TheSheMullet
Got to 10 metres from the cache. Someone from up high was throwing down rocks and stones. Decided to leave it as I had the boy and his mother. Will try again. TFTH

2009-08-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
I was initially going to go to this from Ward cache, but decided to drive instead. My laziness paid off - it was only about 300m from Brookdale where I parked. It was quite an adventure getting there, and I wasn't sure I had the right path until the very end. The No Trespassing signs here are a bit worrying - is this not someone's back garden? Found the cache with some help. There is no garlic now, but I imagine it's great when there is.

wpt.name: GC1Q6XR
wpt.desc: Glorious Garlic by Orangetigerprawn, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Glorious Garlic
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description:
Spring Garlic Forrest


Ward River Valley Regional Park
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This is a linear park on the banks of the Ward River South of Swords town. It covers an area of 89 ha. (220 acres) between Swords Town Centre and Knocksedan Bridge. Features of interest include some 12th century fortifications, woodland habitats, wetlands and rolling grassland. There are viewing points, picnic sites, a public playground, sports pitches and tennis courts.

 


Opening Hours:

The park is open all year round during the following hours:

November to January: 10.00am - 5.00pm
February to March 10.00am - 6.00pm
April 10.00am - 7.00pm
May 10.00am - 8.00pm
June to August 10.00am - 9.00pm
September 10.00am - 8.00pm
October 10.00am - 7.00pm

The Cache

The cache is located in the wild west end of the park. The level of difficulty may depend on, and change according to, your chosen starting point and your tolerance of the wonderful aroma of wild garlic in the spring. Many of the paths at this end of the park can be steep, overgrown, muddy and slippy.

The cache can be approached by the direct method or by using the two waypoints which will bring you to the cache by an easier route. The coordinates were averaged 150 times to an accuracy of 2.7 metres; hopefully helping with satellite reception under the trees.


The cache is a waterproof container of about a litre in capacity.

Additional Waypoints

FP1Q6XR - Forest Path
N 53° 27.397 W 006° 14.598
The path into the forest is the nicest way to go but you can take a route further south through the football pitches.
JP1Q6XR - Jungle Path
N 53° 27.400 W 006° 15.010
Nearly there. It gets harder from here. Easiest to stay below the skeletal trees.

** Coordinates Changed From ** N 53° 27.413 W 006° 15.190 Distance From Old: 515.4 feet Having read some of the finds and DNFs particularly those relating to fences and being overlooked I moved the cache to a accessible location. Visiting the site was more difficult than when placed and the easiest way to the cache was blocked by fencing and barbed wire that had not been there previously. I got to the cache without crossing any fences but there was a large Trespassers Prosecuted sign very close by.
The new location is about 150 metres east of the original location.
New coordinates: N 53° 27.438 W 006° 15.054
Old coordinates: N 53° 27.413 W 006° 15.190
I'm also adding two waypoints to help access.

Got to 10 metres from the cache. Someone from up high was throwing down rocks and stones. Decided to leave it as I had the boy and his mother. Will try again. TFTH

I was initially going to go to this from Ward cache, but decided to drive instead. My laziness paid off - it was only about 300m from Brookdale where I parked. It was quite an adventure getting there, and I wasn't sure I had the right path until the very end. The No Trespassing signs here are a bit worrying - is this not someone's back garden? Found the cache with some help. There is no garlic now, but I imagine it's great when there is.
